name: Language and Society
description: The study of the relationship between language and society with the goal of understanding social structure through language; major themes are multilingual societies, including pidgin and creoles, and social interaction through speech. (Given by the Departments of Anthropology and Linguistics) [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: LIN204, LIN101H5, LIN102H5 (or LIN100Y5), or ANT206H5
